note.p: Birth: Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, England (22 December 1809)
Education: Charterhouse; Caius College, Cambridge. BA (1831), MB (1833), MD (1839, Cambridge, and Dublin); DCL (Oxford and Durham); LLD (Edinb)

Career: Fellow of Caius College, Cambridge; Physician, Addenbrookes' Hospital, Cambridge (1841-1884); President, General Medical Council (1864-1869); Regius Professor of Physic, Cambridge (1872-1892); had a large practice in Cambridge; died of influenza
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1891-1892 vol 50 pp xiii signed by G M H
References: Gudrun Richardson, 'A Norfolk Network within the Royal Society' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 27-39, plate
